column4: does anyone here have experience with mounting windows shared folder on ubuntu?
of course, first sudo apt-get install smbfs
change cifs to smbfs (also install smbfs)
sudo gedit /etc/fstab
ok, then?
do you have the command to login with username and password?

or just change cifs to smbfs will solve the problem? //172.168.100.200/Tour /mnt/Tour smbfs auto,user,username=operation02,workgroup=WORKGROUP ,password=product,uid=500,gid=500,file_mode=0777,d ir_mode=0777,rw 0 0
i will test it now
btw, thanks a lot for help me.. i already investigate this problem about 3 days..
did that work?
i dont think u need the fmask or dmask options
do you want them to not be able to run any windows apps or just certain ones?
why would you want to? xp is ugly
because we do migration from XP to ubuntu about 1 week and some users not suitable with it
i dont think so
apt-get purge
do you mean apt-get purge <packagename>, example: apt-get purge wine ??
thanks
no problem
it saves the actual pacakage i think, apt-get remove will remove the binaries, and docs and stuff, purge will remove all configuration files too

so, apt-get install wine... will save the package to /var/apt/cache, then do apt-get remove wine just uninstall the program, but not delete the config and cache files,.. for complete removal / uninstallation apt-get purge wine, correct? :) thanks all guru!
thanks
